action.action-desc: Mr. McGovern (for himself, Mr. Jones, Mr. Pompeo, Mr. Ellison, Ms. Clark of Massachusetts, and Ms. Tsongas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To authorize the award of a military service medal to members of the Armed Forces who were exposed to ionizing radiation as a result of participation in the testing of nuclear weapons or under other circumstances.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Atomic Veterans Service Medal Act.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Defense shall design and produce a military service medal, to be known as the Atomic Veterans Service Medal, to honor retired and former members of the Armed Forces who are radiation-exposed veterans (as such term is defined in section 1112(c)(3) of title 38, United States Code).

paragraph.header: Issuance to retired and former members
paragraph.text: At the request of a radiation-exposed veteran, the Secretary of Defense shall issue the Atomic Veterans Service Medal to the veteran.
In the case of a radiation-exposed veteran who is deceased, the Secretary may provide for issuance of the Atomic Veterans Service Medal to the next-of-kin of the person.
The Secretary shall prepare and disseminate as appropriate an application by which radiation-exposed veterans and their next-of-kin may apply to receive the Atomic Veterans Service Medal.
